question.title: How to use a Service or Repository from another module in a Java Spring Boot monolithic project?
question.body:
I have an Admin module and a Core module, I have to use the CustomerRepository from Admin module in Core Module. When I try to import the module as a dependency, I get build errors. It says the CustomerRepository is not found, but during compile time it shows and can code.

Here I added the Admin module in Core

<dependency>
    <groupId>com.TMS</groupId>
    <artifactId>tms-admin</artifactId>
    <version>3.4.3</version>
</dependency>

I used the CustomerRepository in the TransportOrder service method like this

@Service 
@RequiredArgsConstructor 
@Slf4j 
public class TransportOrderServiceImpl implements TransportOrderService {

private final CustomerRepository customerRepository;

}

Note: both use a module called tms-common, it's for sharing DTOs across other modules.

I ran mvn clean install -e -X

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:...:compile (default-compile) on project tms-core: Compilation failure:
[ERROR] cannot find symbol
[ERROR]   symbol:   class CustomerRepository
[ERROR]   location: package com.TMS.repository
